div.p: WIDE Project and JSAT Corporation kicked off the AI3 Project with the aim of promoting expertise and knowledge sharing among researchers and engineers in the field of Internet technology, accelerating local Internet development, and developing Internet technologies to utilize several types of datalinks as the Internet connection. The network was planned to use a star-topology satellite links on Ku-band, and the hub would be located in Nara Institute of Science and Technology (NAIST), in Nara, Japan.

In 1995, WIDE Project invited Institut Teknologi Bandung (ITB) in Bandung, Indonesia, Asian Institute of Technology (AIT), in Bangkok, Thailand, and Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST) in Hong Kong as AI3 partners. WIDE Project also planned to invite Korea, Vietnam, Singapore, and Malaysia to join AI3 Project.

div.div: The initial topology of AI3 testbed in 1996.
